books.description: U.S. Department of Agriculture, Farmers' Bulletin No.1438: Making Fermented Pickles. August 1924. Text covers brining, preservation, salt pickles, sour pickles, dill pickles, sauerkraut, fermentation and salting of vegetables, coloring and hardening agents, etc. Includes illustrations and tables. books.title: Food Conservation And The Art Of Canning
books.creator: Sherwood Snyder
books.description: This special edition of "Food Conservation and the Art of Canning" was written by Mrs. Sherwood P. Snyder, and first published in 1917. The book is filled with historic information on the art of canning and preserving food, and the different methods that can be utilized for food preservation at home. An interesting look into how things were done a hundred years ago, and all the fundamentals we still use today. Includes chapters on The Steam Pressure Canner, Hot Water Bath Canners, The Wash Boiler, Glass Jars, The Best Utensils for Canning Acid Food, A Few of the Essentials for Successful Canning, Preserving Eggs, The Open Method of Canning, Instructions and Recipes for Canning...Soups, Meats, Fruits, Jellies, and Preserves, and many more.
books.source_pdf: Food Conservation and the Art of Canning.pdf
